trees.panel.style

Class Style

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • trees.panel.style.Style

  • public class Style
extends java.util.Observable
    A component for configuring the layout of a displayed tree. The style lets you configure:
    • The spacings (in pixels) between siblings, subtrees, and levels. (Defaults: 0)
    • The maximum drawing depth, with 0 only displaying the root. (Default: Integer.MAX_VALUE)
    • The orientation, vertical, and horizontal alignment of the tree. (Default: NORTH|TOP|LEFT)
    • The usage and naming of a root label. (Default: none)
    • The usage of pointer boxes - overall or for explicit node classes. (Default: false)
    • The usage of placeholder - overall or for explicit node classes. (Default: false)
    • The label font - overall or for explicit node classes. (Default: JPanel-Font)
    • The node box size - overall or for explicit node classes. (Default: VARIABLE())
    • The node shape - overall or for explicit node classes. (Default: RECTANGLE)
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Marcus Deininger
    See Also:
    TreePanel

      • getMaxDimension

        public java.awt.Dimension getMaxDimension()
        Calculates the maximum dimension a node can take. This is restricted by the available space between the levels and an additional margin.
        Returns:
        The maximum dimension a node can take.

      • getMaxDimension

        public java.awt.Dimension getMaxDimension(java.awt.Dimension dimension)
        Calculates the maximum dimension a node can take. This is restricted by the available space between the levels and an additional margin and the dimension parameter.
        Parameters:
        dimension - The dimension to be compared with.
        Returns:
        The maximum dimension a node can take.

      • setPlaceHolder

        public void setPlaceHolder(boolean placeHolder)
        Sets the usage of place holders to all tree nodes. Place holders are calculated as nodes but not drawn. This is useful if you want to have spread nodes.
        Parameters:
        placeHolder - true, when to use place holders.

      • setPlaceHolder

        public void setPlaceHolder(java.lang.Class<?> cls,
                  boolean placeHolder)
        Sets the usage of place holders to all tree nodes of type cls. Place holders are calculated as nodes but not drawn. This is useful if you want to have spread nodes.
        Parameters:
        cls - class for which the property to be set.
        placeHolder - true, when to use place holders.

      • usesPlaceHolder

        public boolean usesPlaceHolder(java.lang.Class<?> cls)
        Returns the placeholder property of a given class. If the class is not registered with the property, the overall value is returned.
        Parameters:
        cls - Class for which the property to be returned.
        Returns:
        true, if place holders to be used.

      • getFont

        public java.awt.Font getFont(java.lang.Class<?> cls)
        Returns the font to be used for drawing a node of type cls. If no font is registered for the type, the default font is returned instead.
        Parameters:
        cls - class for which the property to be gotten.
        Returns:
        The node font for cls.

      • setPointerBoxes

        public void setPointerBoxes(boolean pointerBoxes)
        Sets the pointer boxes for all nodes. If true, nodes will be drawn with a small box enclosing the edge origin.
        Parameters:
        pointerBoxes - The pointer box attribute to be set.

      • setPointerBoxes

        public void setPointerBoxes(java.lang.Class<?> cls,
                   boolean pointerBoxes)
        Sets the pointer boxes for of type cls. If true, nodes will be drawn with a small box enclosing the edge origin.
        Parameters:
        cls - class for which the property to be set.
        pointerBoxes - The pointer box attribute to be set.
